decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to utilize the KCI (Krark-Clan Ironworks) combo to generate massive amounts of mana and card advantage. The deck includes various artifacts and engines such as Scrap Trawler, Sai, Master Thopterist, Terrarion, Mind Stone, Mox Opal, and Ichor Wellspring to enable the combo. It also includes card draw and filtering spells like Ancient Stirrings, Chromatic Star, Chromatic Sphere, and Mishra's Bauble to help find the necessary pieces. The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana, recurring artifacts, and draw through the combo to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to power up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Serum Visions to generate card advantage and ensure consistency. Finally, it uses efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board and protect your threats. Additionally, Mishra's Bauble provides card selection and triggers for Death's Shadow's ability.

The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also uses versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope adds additional control elements to the deck, allowing for both disruption and card advantage.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a blend of disruption and efficient creatures. By utilizing a mix of hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate, the deck aims to control the game while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf to quickly close out the game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for flexibility in casting spells of all colors. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and disrupt their game plan to secure a win.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Eldrazi Mimic, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Dismember provide additional disruption, while Serum Powder helps with consistency in starting hands. The land base includes Eldrazi Temple and Gemstone Caverns to accelerate mana production, allowing the deck to cast its threats ahead of schedule.

The main concept of this deck is to use Hardened Scales to boost the +1/+1 counters on your creatures, creating a quick and aggressive playstyle. With cards like Steel Overseer and Hangarback Walker, the deck aims to quickly amass counters and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Arcbound Ravager and Animation Module to further enhance the synergy with Hardened Scales, allowing for explosive turns and strong board presence. The deck focuses on building a strong board presence early and maintaining pressure on the opponent throughout the game.

The main idea behind this Aggro - Red Deck Wins is to apply constant pressure on the opponent using low-cost, efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, not giving the opponent enough time to stabilize or gain control of the game. With a focus on direct damage and efficient creatures like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Goblin Guide, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to mount a defense. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells to ensure maximum aggression.

The core strategy of this UR Storm deck is to quickly build up mana with rituals and cantrips, while reducing the cost of spells with Baral and Goblin Electromancer. The deck aims to assemble a critical mass of spells in the graveyard, enabling powerful combos with Past in Flames and Grapeshot to deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn. Gifts Ungiven is used to search for key combo pieces, while card draw spells like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand help maintain card advantage and consistency. The deck is focused on explosive, fast-paced gameplay and winning in a single turn.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to use a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Cryptic Command, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate card advantage. The deck also includes win conditions like Secure the Wastes and Celestial Colonnade to close out the game once the opponent's threats have been dealt with. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color identity while also providing access to different types of mana required for its spells.

This deck focuses on quickly burning through opponents' life totals using low-cost, high-damage spells and aggressive creatures. By combining efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm with fast creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off opponents before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze allows for additional damage and disruption to further push for a quick victory.

The main idea of this Modern Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up with lands that produce colorless mana, using powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail to control the board, along with utility cards like Mind Stone for additional mana acceleration. The inclusion of burn spells like Ramunap Ruins and creatures like Eldrazi Obligator and Endbringer provide reach and flexibility in dealing with threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain aggression throughout the game.

This deck focuses on casting aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal quick damage to the opponent, aiming to win the game as fast as possible. By playing a mix of efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm, this deck looks to apply pressure early and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is optimized for casting spells quickly, with a focus on red sources to enable the aggressive strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to abuse the graveyard mechanics to quickly fill it with key cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to discard cards and dredge spells like Life from the Loam, players can quickly assemble a strong board presence and deal damage to the opponent with cards like Conflagrate and Creeping Chill. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a relentless stream of creatures and recursive threats from the graveyard, creating a powerful combo strategy.

This aggressive red deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently using a combination of burn spells and efficient creatures. It prioritizes speed and direct damage to the opponent, with cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Monastery Swiftspear allowing for quick bursts of damage. The deck also utilizes creatures like Goblin Guide and Eidolon of the Great Revel to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a low curve and high damage output, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck aims to aggressively fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Pyromancer Ascension and Crackling Drake for additional value and threats. The key strategy is to quickly cycle through the deck, cast multiple spells in a turn, and leverage the synergy between cards to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with instants and sorceries using cards like Thought Scour and Faithless Looting, and then bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. With a mix of cheap removal spells and powerful creatures like Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes a good amount of card draw and deck manipulation to ensure consistency in drawing into its key pieces.
